summary: This is an email exchange between Justin Houston of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions and Steve Smith, a Communication Technician at the US Department of Justice's MCC-New York, regarding a discrepancy in camera models for an installation project. The issue involves cameras not being on the Bureau of Prisons' approved hardware list.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated September 5, 2019, concerning equipment procurement for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
A discrepancy exists between the camera model numbers proposed (Vicon IQM62WR-B9) and those received (Vicon V942D-W312MIR) for an installation project.
The received cameras are not on the Bureau of Prisons' (BOP) approved hardware list, creating an installation issue.
Justin Houston notes that 90 percent of the cameras on the approved list are End of Life (EOL).
The correspondence is between a DOJ/MCC-New York technician and a contractor program manager, indicating a procurement and compliance process for prison facility equipment.
